titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Robert Dana Scott Photographs
2006-2016
PR 363
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Larry Weimer

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-05-31T14:27-0400

did.abstract: The collection includes six albums of color photographs by Robert Dana Scott. The subjects of the albums are street art/murals at 5 Pointz in Long Island City, Queens, and in Bushwick, Brooklyn; street people/homeless and bookshops in Manhattan; boats on the East River; and the lights and street life of Times Square.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: The albums are in roughly chronological order.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Available by advance appointment only. To schedule an appointment, contact the Print Room Librarian at printroom@nyhistory.org.

Most of the photographs include small captions, usually on the reverse, which are commonly obscured by the enclosures. Patrons may not remove the photographs from their enclosures, but need to request assistance from the Reference Librarian for the Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to:
Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org, 212-485-9228.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition Note
acqinfo.p: The albums were gifts of the photographer, Robert Dana Scott, received over time from 2011-2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as Robert Dana Scott photographs, PR 363, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: The collection was processed by archivist Larry Weimer in May 2018.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: The collection includes 6 albums of 4 x 6 inch color photographs by Robert Dana Scott. Each album is centered on a theme and subject matter concerning some aspect of New York City, including street art/murals at 5 Pointz in Long Island City, Queens, and in Bushwick, Brooklyn; street people/homeless in Manhattan; bookshops; East River scenes; and the lights and street life of Times Square.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Dana Scott (born 1951) is a New York City resident, living on 42nd Street.

controlaccess.subject: Street art -- New York (State) -- New York -- Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes about 93 4 x 6 inch color photographs from the mural space in Long Island City, Queens, known as 5 Pointz. (The murals were painted over by the building's owner and developer in 2013.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes an album with 171 4 x 6 inch color photographs of Times Square scenes in 2010. Includes night scenes of the Times Square signage and other lights. Includes tour buses and tourists (Holland soccer fans, zombie convention attendees in costume), signage (e.g., hotels, subway, restaurants, Broadway shows and theatres, adult entertainment venues, Police Department, McDonald's, Ripley's, Madame Tussaud's), buildings, crowds of people, costumed street performers/actors (e.g., Naked Cowboy, Naked Cowgirl, Elmo, tin man), police on duty, pedicabs, news crawls on the sides of buildings, street vendors, protests/demonstrations (e.g., anti-abortion, against meat-eating (PETA), pro-North Korea). Most scenes are from the summer; a few include snowy streets.

did.unittitle: "Misery of the Metropolis: Photographs of Beggars and Battered Souls on the Streets of Manhattan"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes 76 4 x 6 inch color photographs from September 2015 of street people sleeping on sidewalks and alcoves, with signs requesting help or cups for donations, and with bags or carts with their possessions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes 97 4 x 6 inch color photographs of bookshops in early 2016: storefronts, signage, street sales, some interiors. Includes, among others, Argosy, Alabaster, Mysterious, Mast, Book-Off (interiors), Corner, Strand, Shakespeare, Ursus, Bauman, Quest, Left Bank, East Village, Dashwood, Mercer Street, St. Mark's, Book Cellar, La Casa Azul, Crawford Doyle, Logos, Posman, Westsider, Book Culture, McNally Jackson (interiors), 192 Books, Strand stalls in Central Park, Center for Fiction, Rizzoli (interiors), Three Lives, various Barnes & Noble (interiors). Includes a statement of Scott's purpose.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes 90 4 x 6 inch color photographs from April 2016 of street art (i.e., murals on buildings, fencing, and doorway grates). The photos were taken on various streets in Bushwick, Brooklyn, especially Troutman, St. Nicholas, Flushing, Morgan, and Wyckoff. Includes a statement of Scott's purpose.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Includes 69 4 x 6 inch color photographs of East River scenes from late 2016. Includes tugboats, Circle Line and other tour boats, barges, New York Water Taxi, fishing boats, and others. Includes scenes of buildings, bridges, highways, and the Pepsi Cola sign along the river.
